thread.title: Economic confidence drops to lowest level since October
thread.title_full: Economic confidence drops to lowest level since October

author: rshabad@thehill.com (Rebecca Shabad)
title: Economic confidence drops to lowest level since October
text:
Economic confidence drops to lowest level since October By Rebecca Shabad - 08/04/15 04:38 PM EDT 
Economic confidence dropped in July to the lowest monthly average since last October, according to a survey released Tuesday by Gallup. 
The economic confidence index went down to -12 from an average of -8 recorded in June. 
In January, the index was in positive territory, with an average of +3. ADVERTISEMENT Gallup said the index began dropping in February, however, after slow economic growth in the first quarter and continued to drop during the Greek financial crisis.
The index averaged -11 during the last week of July, Gallup said. 
Gallup's Economic Confidence Index is the average of two things: the public’s rating of the current economy and whether people believe the economy is improving or getting worse. 
A quarter of people described the economy in July as “excellent” or “good” while nearly a third said it was “poor.” Thirty-nine percent said the economy is improving and more than half said it’s getting worse. 
The poll surveyed 15,185 adults between July 1 and 31 with a 1 percent margin of error.
